describe: Oman, officially the Sultanate of Oman, is a country on the southeastern coast of the Arabian Peninsula in Western Asia. Known for its rich history, diverse landscapes ranging from deserts to lush green mountains, and a long coastline along the Arabian Sea, Oman offers a unique blend of traditional culture and modern development.

cities.name: üèù Muscat
cities.geographical_location: Located on the northeastern coast of Oman, along the Gulf of Oman.
cities.climate: Muscat has a hot desert climate with very high temperatures in the summer and mild winters.
popular_attractions: Al Jalali and Al Mirani forts

cities.name: üèù Salalah
cities.geographical_location: Situated in the southern part of Oman, in the Dhofar region.
cities.climate: Salalah experiences a tropical desert climate, with a unique monsoon season known as Khareef, bringing cooler temperatures and lush greenery.
cities.famous_cuisine: Mishkak, Harees, and Luban (frankincense) flavored dishes.

cities.name: üèî Nizwa
cities.geographical_location: Located in the Ad Dakhiliyah region, surrounded by the Hajar Mountains.
cities.climate: Nizwa has a hot desert climate, with cooler temperatures in the surrounding mountains.
cities.famous_cuisine: Halwa, Omani bread, and Qabuli rice.
